Name: Amulet of udjat-eye
Description: Green-glazed steatite scaraboid (flat-bottomed seal-shaped amulet) with upper part in the form of the udjat-eye, symbol of restored health, and underside inscribed with the name Amenhotep in hieroglyphs. From the style of the eye and the hieroglyphic signs, this probably refers to king Amenhotep I of the early 18th Dynasty, in whose reign such amulets were first produced in large numbers. Most have survived in tombs.
